channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2023120325
item.description:
Report E-2023120325

item.title: Report E-2023120261
item.description:
Report E-2023120261

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-21T18:11:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-07
  • City: OSCEOLA
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 07, 2023, at 1709 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Osceola, Arkansas regarding the release of approximately (4) gallons of NAD-75 (Corrosive Liquids, N.O.S. UN1760, 8, PG II) from (6) 5-gallon poly pails. Contractors confirmed the release was caused by a load shift from the absence of proper dunnage securing the load, and was contained to a 4’ x 8’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors neutralized and cleaned the release with the proper PPE, and the cargo was then properly secured for transport. The damaged pails containing “materials for reprocessing” were placed in (2) 55-gallon DM’s, which were then taken offsite by the contractor for proper processing.

item.title: Report X-2023120715
item.description:
Report X-2023120715

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Improper handling led to package being discovered upside down. Peper PPE was used, and package was turned upright and placed in hazmat bag and tote. DescribePack: Lid seal had slight leakage due to the pressure of the package being upside down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was turned upright and placed in hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023120293
item.description:
Report X-2023120293

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-01
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: tHE PACKAGE WAS LOCATED UPSIDE DOWN. tHIS CAUSED PRESSURE ON THE LID SEAL AND HALF THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OTHER 3 BOTTLES. package was turned upright and placed in a hazmat bag and drum. DescribePack: Lid seal was opened due to package being placed upside down. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was turned upright and placed in Hazmat drum and bag.

item.title: Report X-2023111066
item.description:
Report X-2023111066

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car was sent over the hump and had an overspeed due to that resulted in a hard couple, rupturing the disc. The disc was blown and replaced in kind by UP Hazmat Manager. The car was neutralized and wiped clean and held for wheel inspection.
